Side: 12 tetradr Yale 2001.87.10608 ANS 1944.100.50917 ANS 1944.100.50910 ANS 1944.100.50924 ANS 1944.100.50920 . Antiochus IV: 6 tetradr. (Antiocheia 5, ANS 1944.100.75286 ANS 1944.100.75291 ANS 1944.100.75288 Ace 1 ANS 1967.152.663 ) Disposition: New York 11 (3 Alexanders, 4 Antiochus IV, 4 Side); Yale 4 Bellinger, AJA 1938, p. 318 Rostovtzeff, Anatolian Stud. Buckler, p. 290 g Seyrig, RN 1963, p. 62; Antiq. syr. 6 (Paris, 1966), p. 9, note 4; Tr√©sors du Levant (in press) Many of the Pamphylian Alexanders and all the coins of Side have ctmks.: anchor or radiate facing bust
